snippet: An International Olympic Committee official charged with monitoring injuries said the Olympic debut of ski and snowboard slopestyle produced an “unacceptably high” number of injuries at the Sochi Games.
abstract: International Olympic Committee official charged with monitoring injuries says the Olympic debut of ski and snowboard slopestyle produced an 'unacceptably high' number of injuries at the Sochi Games and should be dropped from future Games if the disciplines did not become safer.
lead_paragraph: An International Olympic Committee official charged with monitoring injuries said the Olympic debut of ski and snowboard slopestyle produced an “unacceptably high” number of injuries at the Sochi Games.
